result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tia D Eggerson

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge RE: dismissal of case

11:00 AM Defendant Tia D Eggerson in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Tia D Eggerson.  Attorney John M Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 1 & 4- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Cts 1 & 4 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 
Victim impact statement provided. 

BTC: 
Ct 1- 
4 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 years initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days RCJ STAYED. 
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly.
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim M.S. without written consent of the victim and approval of agent. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP
Defendant is not eligible for SAP. 

Ct 4- 3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed consecutive to Ct 1. 
3 years probation.

Defense brings up 22CM358 as part of plea agreement being dismissed and read in. 
Clerk indicates the case was never consolidated. 
State indicates that is correct and is part of the agreement. 
BTC: Court will grant consolidation of 22CM358 and will dismiss and read in the case.

8:49 AM Defendant Tia D Eggerson in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Tia D Eggerson.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense makes statements on the record. Seeking another status conference. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tia D Eggerson in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Tia D Eggerson. Court Reporter: Donna Moore.
Defense is in negotiation with the State. Tracking with Felony case. Seeking another Status date.
BTC: Matter set over
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim M.S (person, property, residence or family).

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tia D Eggerson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Tia D Eggerson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
